Vulnerability.Title: initial-setup bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The initial-setup packages add the initial-setup utility, which runs after installation. It guides the user through a series of steps that allows for easier configuration of the machine. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the el7.x86_64 version of the initial-setup packages incorrectly required the firstboot(windowmanager) dependency. As a consequence, inital-setup could not be installed on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Compute Node variant, because the variant does not include a GUI. This update fixes the dependencies of the initial-setup packages by moving the firstboot(windowmanager) dependency to the initial-setup-gui subpackage. As a result, the initial-setup packages are now available on the RHEL 7 Compute Node variant, as well as other relevant non-GUI environments. (BZ#999464) Due to errors in a number of scripts in the /etc/profile.d/ directory, initial-setup previously failed to start in on IBM System z architecture if the user logged in via SSH. These errors have been fixed and in the described scenario, initial-setup now starts as expected. (BZ#1180576) A typographical error in the file name of the /var/lib/initial-setup file has been corrected. (BZ#1119166) The link to the upstream website in the initial-setup spec file previously led to the wiki page of the deprecated firstboot program. With this update, an upstream wiki page for initial-setup has been created and the link in the spec file has been corrected. (BZ#1152229) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: In order to provide debugging information for the user, initial-setup now sends more extensive error messages to the system log if an error or a failure occurs. (BZ#1153768) The initial-setup README file has been enhanced with new content. (BZ#1110178) The "LOCALIZATION" header in the Initial Setup GUI has been renamed to "LICENSING" to better describe the content under it. (BZ#1039677) Users of initial-setup are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
